Description.val:
The Advanced Tactical Data Link Systems (ATDLS) funds the Time Division Multiple Access family of Link 16 terminals including the Multifunctional Information Distribution System - Low Volume Terminal, Multifunctional Information Distribution System - Joint Tactical Radio System, Joint Tactical Information Distribution System (JTIDS) and the Tactical Digital Information Link - Joint (TADIL-J) message standard databases resident in the Command & Control Processor (C2P)/ Common Data Link Management System (CDLMS).  ATDLS also funds the Command and Control Processor (C2P) Technology Refresh, Next Generation (NG) C2P (NGC2P) upgrades to meet LHD combat system upgrades, Link-22 capability upgrades, Link 16 terminal upgrades and replacements, Link 16 antenna replacements, Link 16 MOS Terminal Controller Central Processing replacements, Link Monitoring Management Tool, and other ATDLS integration.

Command and Control Processor (C2P) Terminal Technology Refresh Full Systems Ship/Shore (DR003): C2P computer processing boards are obsolete and have antiquated software code with no industrial base support. Technology Refresh is required address system hardware obsolescence in order to maintain the C2P system operational availability requirement.

Link 16 Terminal Ship/Shore (DR012): All US Navy ships with legacy Multifunctional Information Distribution System on Ship (MOS) and Joint Tactical Information Distribution System (JTIDS) terminals will have Link 16 terminals replaced with modernized MOS (MOS Mod) terminals to address Crypto Modernization (CM) and Frequency Remapping (FR) mandates and enable the implementation of future enhancements incorporated into the MIDS Joint Tactical Radio System (MIDS-J)terminals. For those ships whose legacy JTIDS or MOS system will not be replaced with MOS Mod by 2025 will have CM/FR
product improvement kits installed into the terminal to meet the FR requirement. The overall product improvement effort will bring the Link 16 terminals in compliance with the Department of Defense / Department of Transportation Memorandum of Agreement (31DEC02) and updated National Security Agency approved cryptographic algorithms.

Link 16 Antenna Replacement (DR012): Existing obsolete dedicated Link 16 shipboard antenna will be replaced.

Link Monitoring Management Tool (LMMT) Ship/Shore (DR014): LMMT is required to enable Joint Interface Control Officers (JICOs) to effectively monitor and manage the performance of tactical data link networks. Funds procurement and installation of LMMT hardware on ships and shore sites. MIDS will also be procured and installed for CVNs.

Advanced Tactical Data Link Systems (ATDLS) Training (DR666): Develop initial end-to-end training curriculum and simulators.

Justification.val:
The FY2020 funding request was reduced by $2.0 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances. 

Overall budget control increase from FY2019 to FY2020 due to achieving full rate production for Link 16 in FY20 and updating the Link 16 fielding schedule to meet Fleet requirements.

Advanced Tactical Data Link Systems (ATDLS) procure command and control equipment for both shipboard and shore units including Link 16 Network Program Crypto Modernization (CM) and Frequency Remapping (FR) Upgraded Terminals, Link 16 Network Program Antennas, Command and Control Processor (C2P) hardware and software, and Link Monitoring Management Tool (LMMT) hardware and software to address Air Defense System Integrator (ADSI) obsolesce issues.

Remarks.val:
BLI 2614 procures data link components (e.g. circuit cards, routers, antennas, shock mounts, etc.) to replace obsolete ones. There is integration and testing of these components lasting 6-9 months, which causes procurements to be installed in the following fiscal year.

Unit cost and installation cost varies by ship/site due to different configurations required for both shore and ship systems.

Name.val: Adv Tact Data Link Sys (ATDLS) - DR003 C2P

Name.@footnote: The FY-20 ATDLS budget has consolidated many procurement and installation lines into single procurement or installation line management by ship and shore. "C2P Terminal Shore" replaces the name "C2P Technology Refresh Full System Shore".

Name.val: Adv Tact Data Link Sys (ATDLS) - DR012 LINK 16

Name.@footnote: "Link 16 Terminal Shore" consolidates "Link 16 JTIDS Shore, Link 16 MOS Shore, Link 16 MOS MOD Shore".
"Link 16 Antenna" consolidates "Link 16 ESB-4 Antennas" and "Link 16 Upgrade Antenna".

Name.val: Adv Tact Data Link Sys (ATDLS) - DR014 LINK MONITORING MANAGEMENT TOOL (LMMT)

Name.@footnote: "LMMT Ship" consolidates "LMMT Ship (CVN)" and "LMMT Ship (L Class)".
"C2P Terminal Shore" replaces the name "C2P Technology Refresh Full System Shore".
"Link 16 Terminal Shore" consolidates "Link 16 JTIDS Shore, Link 16 MOS Shore, Link 16 MOS MOD Shore".
"Link 16 Antenna" consolidates "Link 16 ESB-4 Antennas" and "Link 16 Upgrade Antenna".
"Production Support" and "DSA" consolidated into a single ship/shore line by product.
"LMMT Ship" consolidates "LMMT Ship (CVN)" and "LMMT Ship (L Class)".
"Production Support" and "DSA" consolidated into a single ship/shore line by product.

Name.val: 2.2) Link 16 Terminal Ship / Shore Production Support
2.4) C2P Terminal Ship / Shore Production Support

Name.@footnote: The FY20 ATDLS budget has consolidated many procurement and installation lines into single line management by ship and shore.  "Link 16 Terminal Ship" consolidates all lines from called "Link 16 JTIDS Ship, Link 16 MOS ship, Link 16 MOS MOD ship, Link 16 MOS terminal controllers (TC)."  The average unit cost fluctuation is primarily attributed to variance in system configuration requirements for each Link 16 platform type.
"C2P Terminal Ship" consolidates "C2P Technology Refresh Full System Ship" and "C2P LHD Upgrades".

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Link 16 Terminal Ship
[none specified]:: Installation Name: C2P Terminal Ship

Description.val:
Command and Control Processor (C2P) Technology Refresh Full Systems Ship: C2P computer processing boards are obsolete and have antiquated software code with no industrial base support.  Technology refresh is required for C2P software modernization.  Additionally, C2P configuration is not shock qualified. Full Systems upgrades are required to achieve 901D shock certification.

"Unit cost and installation cost varies by ship/site due to different configurations required for both shore and ship systems."
